t: Isaiah 66
True Worship and False
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Heaven*pn is*i My throne, And*ld earth is*i My footstool. Where*ld is*i the house that you will build Me? And*ld where is*i the place of My rest?

For*ld all those things*i My hand has made, And*ld all those things*i exist,” Says*ld the Lord.*s “But*ld on this one*i will I look: On*ld him*i who*i is*i poor and of a contrite spirit, And*ld who trembles at My word.

“He*ln who kills a bull is*i as*i if*i he slays a man; He*ld who sacrifices a lamb, as*i if*i he breaks a dog’s neck; He*ld who offers a grain offering, as*i if*i he*i offers*i swine’s blood; He*ld who burns incense, as*i if*i he blesses an idol. Just*ld as they have chosen their own ways, And*ld their soul delights in their abominations,

So*ld will I choose their delusions, And*ld bring their fears on them; Because,*ld when I called, no one answered, When*ld I spoke they did not hear; But*ld they did evil before My eyes, And*ld chose that*i in which I do not delight.”
The Lord Vindicates Zion

Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s You*ld who tremble at His word: “Your*ld brethren who hated you, Who*ld cast you out for My name’s sake, said, ‘Let*ld the Lord*s be glorified, That*ld we may see your joy.’ But*ld they shall be ashamed.”
The*ln sound of noise from the city! A*ld voice from the temple! The*ld voice of the Lord,*s Who*ld fully repays His enemies!
“Before*ln she was in labor, she gave birth; Before*ld her pain came, She*ld delivered a male child.

Who*ld has heard such a thing? Who*ld has seen such things? Shall*ld the earth be made to give birth in one day? Or*ild shall a nation be born at once? For*ld as soon as Zion was in labor, She*ld gave birth to her children.
Shall*ld I bring to the time of birth, and not cause delivery?” says the Lord.*s “Shall*ld I who cause delivery shut up the*i womb?”*i says your God.
“Rejoice*ln with Jerusalem, And*ld be glad with her, all you who love her; Rejoice*ld for joy with her, all you who mourn for her;
That*ld you may feed and be satisfied With*ld the consolation of her bosom, That*ld you may drink deeply and be delighted With*ld the abundance of her glory.”

For*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn I will extend peace to her like a river, And*ld the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream. Then*ld you shall feed; On*ld her*i sides shall you be carried, And*ld be dandled on her*i knees.
As*ld one whom his mother comforts, So*ld I will comfort you; And*ld you shall be comforted in Jerusalem.”
The Reign and Indignation of God
When*pn you see this,*i your heart shall rejoice, And*ld your bones shall flourish like grass; The*ld hand of the Lord*s shall be known to His servants, And*ld His*i indignation to His enemies.
For*ld behold, the Lord*s will come with fire And*ld with His chariots, like a whirlwind, To*ld render His anger with fury, And*ld His rebuke with flames of fire.
For*ld by fire and by His sword The*ld Lord*s will judge all flesh; And*ld the slain of the Lord*s shall be many.

“Those*ln who sanctify themselves and purify themselves, To*ild go*i to the gardens After*ld an idol*i in the midst, Eating*ld swine’s flesh and the abomination and the mouse, Shall*ld be consumed together,” says the Lord.*s
“For*p I know*i their works and their thoughts. It shall be that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come and see My glory.

I will set a sign among them; and those among them who escape I will send to the nations: to*i Tarshish and Pul and Lud, who draw the bow, and Tubal and Javan, to*i the coastlands afar off who have not heard My fame nor seen My glory. And they shall declare My glory among the Gentiles.

Then they shall bring all your brethren for an offering to the Lord*s out of all nations, on horses and in chariots and in litters, on mules and on camels, to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the Lord,*s “as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the Lord.*s
And I will also take some of them for priests and*i Levites,” says the Lord.*s
“For*pn as the new heavens and the new earth Which*ld I will make shall remain before Me,” says the Lord,*s “So*ld shall your descendants and your name remain.
And*ld it shall come to pass That*ild from one New Moon to another, And*ld from one Sabbath to another, All*ld flesh shall come to worship before Me,” says the Lord.*s

“And*ln they shall go forth and look Upon*ld the corpses of the men Who*ld have transgressed against Me. For*ld their worm does not die, And*ld their fire is not quenched. They*ld shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.”
